oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mixed finite element method for a strongly damped wave equation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PANI, AK
YUAN, JY
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: hyperbolic-equations
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A mixed finite element Galerkin method is analyzed for a strongly damped wave equation. Optimal error estimates in L-2-norm for the velocity and stress art: derived using usual energy argument, while those for displacement are based on the nonstandard energy formulation of Baker. Both a semi-discrete scheme and a second-order implicit-time discretization method are discussed, and it is shown that the results are valid for all t > 0. (C) 2001 . Inc.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: NUMERICAL METHODS FOR PARTIAL DIFFERENTIAL EQUATIONS, 17(2), 105-119
